alert.note: Alert for Casper Mountain; Natrona County Lower Elevations (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 3:01PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Natrona County through 330 PM MDT... At 300 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southeast of Beartrap Meadows County Park, which is also 13 miles south of Casper, moving northwest at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. Very heavy rain is likely causing localized flooding on the south side of Casper Mountain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Beartrap Meadows County Park around 315 PM MDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Casper, Mills, Red Butte, and Paradise Valley. This includes Interstate 25 near mile marker 188. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Very heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away froTorrentialm a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.
